intro: Ecclinusa parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered ecclinusa, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous plant with slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the wet season. Ecclinusa parviflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
